ygData.subject: Re: Pets
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t think so. :( ... From: James Lecouffe  To:  Sent: Sunday, May 09, 1999 10:13 PM Subject: Re:
ygData.messageBody:
I don't think so. :(

----- Original Message -----
From: James Lecouffe <puma@...>
To: <EQ_Necromancer@onelist.com>
Sent: Sunday, May 09, 1999 10:13 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Necromancer] Pets


> From: "James Lecouffe" <puma@...>
>
> When you reclaim a pet do you get the bones back?
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Andy <skimaster@...>
> To: 'eq_necromancer@onelist.com' <eq_necromancer@onelist.com>
> Date: Sunday, May 09, 1999 7:01 PM
> Subject: [EQ_Necromancer] Pets
>
>
> >From: Andy <skimaster@...>
> >
> >Personally, I believe that there is no problem with not knowing a pets
> abilities. That adds to the mystery of it, because you never know(except
> through a con) quite how good the skel is. It doesn't really bother me
> really, cause it allows great RP situations - If it is a weakling, I will
> cast Reclaim Energy on it and start muttering about the weakling undead
> being summoned lately, and grumbling in general. Anyone else feel this
way?
> Also, I am a Gnome Necromancer on Fennin Ro. Any suggestions as to what
> spells to buy at level 8? Iam right now leaning obviously to the Pet and
to
> Gather Shadows, and if there is a new Darkness spell I may buy that. Any
> others?
> >
> >Leanne, level 5 Gnome Necromancer
> >
